page.title: 01LANDSCAPE CLAPHAM/NEWBY
page.content: Clapham-cum-Newby lies in a limestone district to the West of the Pennines in N.Yorkshire,with caves,streams,and waterfalls as common features. The area round Clapham is mainly fields,but if you go North you come to Clapdale Scar which is a pretty rough rocky area at the foot of Ingleborough.The land slopes from North to South,and about an eigth of the area is woodland.Clapham Beck feeds into the River Wenning. To the North of the village is the hamlet of Newby(72,78 70,12).It has one street and one stream through the middle of the village,but it is smaller in area and population than Clapham.Now-a-days the main road by-passes both villages.South and west of Clapham the land is less rocky and steep,it is moorland.
